alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 3:30PM EDT until September 01 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents are forecast. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level is expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Tidal areas in the New Jersey counties of Monmouth and Ocean. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through Friday evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 8:00 PM this evening until 2:00 AM Friday. * IMPACTS...At this level, flooding begins on the most vulnerable roads in coastal and bayside communities, and along inland tidal waterways. Some partial or full road closures are possible. Also, rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional minor tidal flooding may occur in some areas with Friday evening`s high tide cycle. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Sandy Hook Bay at Sandy Hook MLLW Categories - Minor 6.7 ft, Moderate 7.7 ft, Major 8.7 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 31/09 PM 7.2 2.0 0.8 Minor 01/09 AM 6.7 1.5 0.8 Minor 01/10 PM 6.9 1.7 0.7 Minor 02/10 AM 6.5 1.3 0.5 None 02/11 PM 6.3 1.1 0.5 None 03/11 AM 6.3 1.1 0.4 None Watson Creek at Manasquan MLLW Categories - Minor 5.7 ft, Moderate 6.7 ft, Major 7.7 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 31/09 PM 6.2 1.8 0.4 Minor 01/09 AM 5.7 1.3 0.3 Minor 01/10 PM 5.9 1.5 0.3 Minor 02/10 AM 5.5 1.1 0.1 None 02/10 PM 5.3 0.9 0.0 None 03/11 AM 5.3 0.9 -0.1 None Barnegat Bay at Barnegat Light MLLW Categories - Minor 3.5 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.0 ft, Moderate 2.0 ft, Major 3.0 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 31/09 PM 3.8 1.3 0.6 Minor 01/09 AM 3.5 1.0 0.6 Minor 01/10 PM 3.6 1.1 0.5 Minor 02/10 AM 3.3 0.8 0.3 None 02/10 PM 3.0 0.5 0.1 None 03/11 AM 3.1 0.6 0.1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Stay out of the surf. If you are ever caught in a rip current, relax and float. Do not swim against the current. If possible, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
